casebody.data:
[No. 8,147. In Bank.] Jan. 19, 1882. H. M. NAGLEE v. FRANCIS E. SPENCER, Judge, etc. Appeal—Jurisdiction—Motion fob Wew Trial.—An appeal from a judgment does not divest the trial Court of jurisdiction to hear and determine a motion for a new trial. Application for writ of mandamus,

William Matthews, for Plaintiff

J. C. Black, for Defendant.

The Court:

The appeal from the judgment did not divest the trial Court of jurisdiction to hear and determine the motion for a new trial.

Let the writ issue as prayed for.
